website_summaries.verdict: A single-trumpet horn that blares a loud signal, comes with all the hardware and an air compressor for installation.
pros: Tough enough to withstand weather and last through years of use
Portable, with the ability to take it from one car to another
Comes with air compressor and hose
cons: It may not be as loud as expected
Doesn't come with power source or wiring for installation

customer_reviews.title: Was given a used unit
customer_reviews.text: I was given a used unit with a dented box. Horn was rusty and had pitting like it’s been used through a winter. It was also missing mounting hardware. Complete trash!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Fun little Jeep Wrangler JK upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Fun little Jeep Wrangler JK upgrade. Pretty damn loud. Lower tone than electric horns. Tricky to install and had to replace the 10 amp fuse with a 20 amp fuse, but so far, so good. Slight delay when you honk because the compressor takes a split second to fire up, but it's faster than i expected. Mounted mine on the frame crossbar under the radiator with extensions on the stock horn wires. I recommend angling the horn slightly downward so it can't collect water.
customer_reviews.author: L. MARTIN

customer_reviews.title: It  may work properly if it didn't have to be mounted outside!
customer_reviews.text: Installed the horn fairly simple, sounded fine . Then I actually had to use it. The first few times no problem. .the weather started getting colder then suddenly the tone started to change down to a weak squeal . I tried it a few more times with no traffic around then that was it! Died. .I could still hear the compressor trying it's heart out to make a sound then it gave up! I consider the horn as one of the most important part of a vehicle's safety system. Now I have nothing. I kept the original horns, so I guess they are going back in...Flimsy JUNK
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Murlo

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: First off, this horn is NOT easy to install! I took mine to a GOOD car stereo installer and it took him 2.5-hrs to install! This horn IS loud, but it lasted me all of 15-min/3 honks. After installation, he honked it. Out in the parking lot, I honked it. Down the road, I honked it again for the hell of it. 10-min into my drive home, some idiot cut me off so I 'attempted' to honk it: Nothing... radio silence. But for $27, what could I possibly expect? This horn IS loud and I'd be writing a muuuch more positive review had it lasted me longer than 15-min/3 honks. SAVE YOUR MONEY and buy someone else's product.
customer_reviews.author: A. C. Lunn

customer_reviews.title: Horn's like a thick plastic maybe metal
customer_reviews.text: Hard to install. Horn's like a thick plastic maybe metal....... Kinda quality kinda not.... the compressors kinda weak, you don't get a earth shaking sound but you don't get a squeak... something im glad i took the time to install (a lot of time) that I wish performed a little bit better too though.. looking back on it I'd probably have opt'ed for an all-metal more quality-built horn with a small -AIR- compressor, but for the cost all in all, it's staying in my truck for now but will replace someday when i want an upgrade. this is an entry-level-decent air horn.
customer_reviews.author: Chase Randall

customer_reviews.title: Go ahead, make my day.
customer_reviews.text: I cant wait to blow some road blocking ANTIFA mutt's hair off with this thing..
customer_reviews.author: Paw Paw

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely ticked off
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working within a month I loved it before it stopped working on me. Can’t even contact the seller because I don’t know how.
customer_reviews.author: Blaze

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Purchased April 9! Compressor is SHOT, BROKEN, JUNK! NO LONGER WORKS!!!!DO NOT PURCHASE SAVE YOUR MONEY!!!
customer_reviews.author: BIG DADDY

customer_reviews.title: VERY LOUD Train Horn sound
customer_reviews.text: My after market electric horn only lasted 6 month, so I decided to go with these using the original stock horn wire. Took me about 30 min and when my 7 yr old pushed the steering wheel horn he got a big scare. Even my wife said it made her ears hurt ( she was 30 ft behind the truck ) I may purchase another set for the left side wire connection. Will update on use and life of horn.
customer_reviews.author: ASAP Pest Conrol

customer_reviews.title: Whoooomp!  WHOOOOOMP!!!
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly good sound! It really DOES sound like a truck horn and not one of those cheap aerosol "air horns". Did not come with complete mounting hardware, nor detailed instructions. However, it was easy enough to figure out. It draws about 14 amps when active.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Barker

customer_reviews.title: Rough Pitted Chrome but it honks
customer_reviews.text: While I got this at a great price 16.00 quick sell but they must have sent me someone else returned item .The chrome is pitted and rough feeling and the parts bag was torn open the box had razored out holes in it which I recon must have had something printed on it they didn't want seen .It does work so great on that part. I wouldn't display it on any vehicles .I will keep it .and use it outside my work shop for a BEAR SCARE HORN. It serves my purpose but would recommend something better then this product because of the rough pitted chrome .
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: loud horn, works fine
customer_reviews.text: I was worried after reading the reviews that this horn was weak or soft. It is NOT true. I wired mine strait from the battery with a 30 amp inline fuse with 10 gauge wire to the relay. I then used 14 gauge wire from the relay to the horn compressor. 14 gauge for the grounds on the compressor and relay, then a 14 gauge for the sense wire spliced into the positive side of my existing stock 95 jeep yj horns. When I hit the horn I get the small beep of the jeep, and a very loud honkin air horn. Tried it out in the parking lot at the airport, works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: spotty

customer_reviews.title: Makes idiots poop their pants
customer_reviews.text: Finding a place close to existing horn was the trick because of its length, since it didn't fit where original one was, but hooked into existing horn wire and WOW! And went from a 15 to a 25 amp horn fuse and it blew my socks off. Very impressed.. Yes , im going to get one for my wifes car pretty soon. Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Raz

customer_reviews.title: Not all they are cracked up to be
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these horns at first. My husband installed them. Right away the one did not work. I contacted Amazon and was sent a replacement. By the time I received the replacement (2days) the other one quit working, so my husband didn't bother installing the replacement. I sent them (3) all back.
customer_reviews.author: PaulaE

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little horn. Install was simple and easy. I connected to my factory horn and disconnected that. So it would work with my steering wheel horn. Love scaring people that are walking past. Pretty loud to be this cheap. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Jimbob

customer_reviews.title: The electric pump is week but the horn is loud and actually decent quality
customer_reviews.text: The electric pump only puts out 18-20 psi, I prefer to use a tank of compressed air. In my opinion it sounds a lot better at 30-40psi. Don't go too high on with the air pressure or you'll blow out the diaphragm. Had the horn on top of my car for about 3 months exposed to rain and dirt. Still works fine. It will definitely start to show worse sings of ware after about a year and it may not fair well in the winter with salt and more wetness. Mount it somewhere under your hood or in a covered place if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Loud Horn!
customer_reviews.text: It was dirty and had a dent in it. I thought I would try it before I sent it back. Hooked it up to a battery and it was loud enough.It sparked pretty good when I touched the terminal to the battery, so I put a 12v dc 30 amp relay with 10 gauge wire and a 20 amp fuse from the battery for the horn. Hooked the hot wire from the horn to the relay. Both horns blow together and will get your attention. Kept the airline short so no delay. I put this in my motorhome. I’m happy with the sound and volume for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kent D. Zehring

customer_reviews.title: Solid horn for the price. Needs relay.  Easily installed.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and sounds adequately loud. Using on my gas engined RV and it fits the bill. Gets me noticed when needed. It SHOULD come with the 30amp relay, but no you have to buy extra. The instructions DON'T tell you that you need a relay...(AND IT SHOULD), however basic mechanics or a little you tubing can tell you what/how to install.
customer_reviews.author: Trip Pinonit

customer_reviews.title: Great value and fun!!
customer_reviews.text: Works really well - I was impressed! For $30 or whatever it costs it’s as great way to have a little fun. Came with everything you need to install. I had a little extra wire and a $8 switch I added to my dash. Thing is KICK BUTT. Ended up wiring it to my lawn mower - cub cadet XT1 for a little backyard fun. It’s certainly louder with the hood ‘open’ rather than ‘closed’. It’s loud.... but ain’t no train horn. Bottom line, for $30 it will meet/beet expectations but don’t expect to to be equivalent to any $300+ multiple horn systems or anything even REMOTELY close to a train horn.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt G

customer_reviews.title: Good product, great with updated supplies.
customer_reviews.text: This product price is AWSOME. Expect some other cost factors. 10 gauge wire(X2 color code your work), 30amp fuse link and higher end relay. Installed 30 amp link from battery and used aux accessory switch in truck, 10 gauge ground to metal, may be overkill but flip the switch and it is loud. Not 150 decibels but louder and air horn distinctive. Louder than stock Ford which is loud. Suggest this product with the proper added cost for extra parts and no install on cars are ever as easy as thought.
customer_reviews.author: Techsilver

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!!
customer_reviews.text: This horn is absolutely awesome. However I did not use my truck wiring as other reviewers had indicated it did not carry enough voltage to work properly. With an after market wire harness, a separate switch from my Ford factory horn, this horn is extremely loud. The only problem I have is where to mount it. I want to keep it somewhat covered (just because a personal preference). The horn is extremely long which makes it difficult to find a good place. But well worth the value. I'm actually thinking of buying a second horn in mounting them side by side wherever I find that place to be.
customer_reviews.author: Vandal21

customer_reviews.title: Switch around the leads and works good. This is a deeper one tone horn that ...
customer_reviews.text: If you wire it backwards you will not get any sound from the horn but the pump will act as if it is working. Switch around the leads and works good. This is a deeper one tone horn that has been working good for the last 5mo when I installed it.
customer_reviews.author: southwind

customer_reviews.title: A lot of decibels for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to my factory Chevy horn! This was easy to tie into the existing horn by tapping into the horn's hot and ground wires. It took some creativity to find a space to hide this horn, because it's pretty big, but it is horizontal between the grill and the radiator. It is LOUD! I'm very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Combs

customer_reviews.title: This is one loud horn!
customer_reviews.text: I just bought a new/used boat and it had a dead air horn. No idea how many years it was on there, but the salt water environment finally got to it. I checked the compressor and found it was still pushing air, so I looked for a new horn that might match the old one. This one looked right. In fact, I suspect it is exactly the same unit. I plugged the new trumpet onto the old compressor hose, and eureka, all set. I'll keep the compressor as a spare. It's darn loud! Very pleased, especially for $29.95.
customer_reviews.author: Marc D Zito

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last
customer_reviews.text: With very minimal usage over the 9 months I had the horn, the compressor no longer works. I checked the fuse, relay, and switch and have tried powering the compressor off the battery with no luck. Horn did the job when it worked but has a poor longevity I would not but another one.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Frank

customer_reviews.title: Good horn
customer_reviews.text: There really isn't much to the install. I installed this on a 2011 f250. The stock horn was weak. I saw this horn on Amazon. Price good not to hard to install. I spliced into the stock horn wiring and use both at same time. I am not out to scare or prank, I just want people to know where I am at while driving. This horn does that with no problem. Definitely an attention getter.
customer_reviews.author: Art M

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME DEAL
customer_reviews.text: 1992 Acura Integra, **UPDATE 2 YEARS IN HORN STILL WORKS AWESOME** installed it behind the bumper replacing a factory horn. This horn is not nearly 150db but it's an absolute upgrade from any car horn. The horn barely fit, had to use my own self tapping screws to mount it. Luckily I was able to use the stock hose and mount the compressor near by. Only one complaint, one time I honked the horn and it gave me an awfully weak chirp... I thought it had broken already. I then honked again and it was fine. Hopefully it lasts, I will update.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Duenas

customer_reviews.title: Horn is loud.
customer_reviews.text: The horn itself is great. Nice and loud. It did not come with instructions or notes that I may need additional items (which I did) for it to work, but the horn is great. If you are mechanically inclined and have a friend that is and want a loud horn, then this is it. The additional items I needed (and a lot of you will need) are: relay, wiring and a fuse holder.
customer_reviews.author: J. Grafford

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, nice and loud, but add a 30a relay for many installs.
customer_reviews.text: Really loud air horn, easy set up. Just needed to add a relay to my current horn circuit. I used the existing horn wire to trigger my 30a relay that I wired Between the battery and the horn. The only thing I didn’t like is the threads where the trumpet threads into the horn are a bit weak and sloppy, but it hasn’t fallen apart yet. Installed in my nieces Nissan Versa sideways in front of the radiator. It really adds attitude to the cute little car.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts!!
customer_reviews.text: No hose was sent in the package with the horn. Can’t leave a review of the sound because......Again no damn hose!
customer_reviews.author: Derrick

customer_reviews.title: Buy this, it's LOUD
customer_reviews.text: Great horn.. Super loud. Louder than the disk horn i got from local auto parts. 2 months later, the bracket holding the horn broke and Because of where i had to mount it (under front bumper cowl) when it broke today, it got dragged the whole way home and did what you see in the picture. I'll have to make my own mount and get it back on. This is not a bad review at all, just note, the mounting bracket is PLASTIC.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin R.

customer_reviews.title: It sounds loud in my house
customer_reviews.text: It only sounds loud in my house, but not louder then my regular horn 🎷 outside in car.
customer_reviews.author: Credit

customer_reviews.title: Loud horn but not that loud
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice horn for the money. Not quite as loud as I expected but decent enough to let someone know you're there. I mounted mine in the engine compartment on the interior fender skirt since that was the only place that would fit. Trumpet is extremely long and it kept me from mounting it in the front of the vehicle. Overall the horn is great for the price and it does the job!
customer_reviews.author: Bagobones

customer_reviews.title: Loud
customer_reviews.text: So far they are very good and loud, hopefully they stand the test of time, easy install but you will most likely blow the 15 amp fuse connected to the relay, that's how it is in my 2002 GMC anyway. I would suggest running a separate power line with a heavier gauge wire directly from the battery.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Deacon

customer_reviews.title: Plenty loud
customer_reviews.text: I manage a spotting service (yard dog, mule) for a large manufacture. Our Autocar trucks came with a small car horn that can not get anyones attention. My drivers need to be able to get an idiot, third party carrier to STOP when we see them backing into another trailer... or truck... from across the yard; easily 200-300 feet away. These horns are plenty loud to be heard at distance and over the noise Diesel engines. The drivers all love them.
customer_reviews.author: Wandering Bicycle

customer_reviews.title: I went ahead and purchased a different brand compressor and it works great. The horn itself works great but the compressor ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my truck and once we got it all hooked up with a wiring harness I purchased, it did not work. I believe we had a faulty compressor because it never did anything. I went ahead and purchased a different brand compressor and it works great. The horn itself works great but the compressor is cheap and might break when you try to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Cristal

customer_reviews.title: BETTER HORN KITS ON AMAZON
customer_reviews.text: This is a joke- There are NO INSTRUCTIONS at all... although you can google it... But the kit has not enough wire to do anything. You need to purchase more wire to put this in any truck or car....
customer_reviews.author: Jax Fl. Guy

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and OK
customer_reviews.text: Effective sound, but materials made with are very cheap. Be careful installing as it's all plastic and if anything breaks you won't be able to secure it down. No wiring instructions or diagram included. I had to look up on the web how to wire it up. Makes a loud enough sound, but the pump is subrate, not sure how long it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Thank you

customer_reviews.title: Quality wasn’t as good as the other model I got so I ended up returning this one.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this and another train horn and ended up keeping the other one they both cost about the same and the quality just seems a lot better on the other products so I returned this one. It is pretty loud but about the same as mostly all the other ones they sell on here beside the duel and large tank sets.
customer_reviews.author: Dabloesco

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Loud. I ordered 2, cause I want them to really move out of my way. One compressor only lasted 16 months. Used it less than 40 times during that time. 2nd compressor quit due to connection corrosion, cleaned and now works again. Had to upgrade the fuse initially. Good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Nice Horn!
customer_reviews.text: Now my Forester has a horn that gets attention! You will need wire, fuse holder, fuse, and relay. Wire it for, and use, a 20 amp fuse . I added a push button on the dash, so I can use either horn. I had one of these in my old car for three years, never a problem .
customer_reviews.author: AH-HA!!!

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: Hey! I'm a OTR Truck driver and nothing beats an awesome Horn to get peoples attention! especially today since almost everyone is driving with their noises in their laps! Put this on my F150 Ecobooost and people know when they mess up if im close, also works great for me being in the VFD in town.
customer_reviews.author: Ray W.

customer_reviews.title: Compressor sheared in one toot
customer_reviews.text: Glad I attached test wires and gave it a blast before installing on my truck. One toot and the compressor pump unit sheared there housing, no pressure after that. I took it apart and the pump element is a sealed unit. I can see the broken plastic bits up in the bearing housing where the motor shaft connects. Motor seems fine, horn blasts with air from my shop compressor. From reading all the bad reviews it sounds like this is a common failure. Cheap brittle plastic parts. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Owen William Fritts

customer_reviews.title: Air pump broke
customer_reviews.text: Air pump died after 3 months of almost no use. Can't stand up to dirt road vibrations. Made electrical noise when triggered but not enough psi to toot the horn. I uninstalled the pump and all kinds of fragments were shaking around in it. Switched to another woho 18psi compressor and horn works again. Emits a louder lower frequency road weasel scaring tone.
customer_reviews.author: G.

customer_reviews.title: Deep and loud, sounds like a train!
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased 3 or 4 air horn kits to put on my trucks over the years. Usually whatever I could find at autozone. After buying this one I'll never go back! This horn is deep and loud!! WARNING! Don't honk at the elderly ;)
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great value horn
customer_reviews.text: I am absolutely happy with the purchase of this horn. It seems very durable. It’s very low compared to stock horns. I installed in 2017 tundra. I believe they should give you a wiring harness and mounting brackets. Besides this it’s a great purchase for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Big Rob NYC

customer_reviews.title: NOT 150DB
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and definitely louder than a stock auto horn but however, NOT the 150 DB as advertised
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Fun with drivers how text and drive.
customer_reviews.text: I installed two of these behind the front grill of my 2017 Silverado 3500HD. Wiring required an inline fuse and a 30 amp relay which was not included with the horn. The result is a really loud and effective horn. It is fun to scare the drivers who text and drive.
customer_reviews.author: Joe C.

customer_reviews.title: The shipping was fast. Product is as described. ...
customer_reviews.text: The shipping was fast. Product is as described. Based on most other reviews, I chose this one because people said it was loud. Many in this price range are not very loud. I assure you, it is. I wired it through a relay (not included) and mounted it in my 1978 F150. It gets attention. I almost want to add another one to make it twice as loud.
customer_reviews.author: D F    Atlanta, Ga.

customer_reviews.title: Loud horn but Cheap Compressor
customer_reviews.text: The horn was great sounding the three times it worked. I have tested everything and the compressor is defective/cheaply made. I hooked up a compressor I had from a previous horn that lasted ten years and the horn works good. Too bad they couldn't make a quality compressor. I recommend trying another horn if you do not want to tinker with what broke because it's cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Schumann88

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade...
customer_reviews.text: Works better than expected. Installs easily and the sounds is far louder than an stock horn. I just spliced the positive to the new horn relay into the existing horn wire on the truck and now I have this horn AND the factory horns. Nice upgrade for sure.
customer_reviews.author: BangBang

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Received rusted item. I left it in a box after receiving for installation on a free day assuming product was new. Opened the amazon box today and the internal box was damaged. The horn was dinged and rusted and there are NO instructions. Now I'm left with a non working hunk of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: ~W

customer_reviews.title: Loud
customer_reviews.text: Extremely loud. Sounds just like a tractor trailer truck. Just what my old man was looking for! Easy installation if you have the slightest clue.
customer_reviews.author: Chris J. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Ok product
customer_reviews.text: No instructions or wires very cheep but it works it’s somewhat load not disappointed cause they served the purpose I needed them for. But don’t think you getting a nice set of train horns for your truck.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Cheap laughs at others expense
customer_reviews.text: Its not a train horn but it sure turns heads or makes that annoying driver ahead of you jump. Ive had may road rage situations with gratifying endings with this horn. Oh, and the pan handlers, they get the blast too.
customer_reviews.author: brett bissonnette

customer_reviews.title: Good truck horn
customer_reviews.text: A good product to add to your car to warn careless drivers who keeps on texting at traffic lights when the light is green already or for stupid people cutting you on the freeway. I suggest you keep the stock horn and have this as an extra one for crazy driver on the road.
customer_reviews.author: C. Beleno

customer_reviews.title: Single 12" air horn is a dudd.
customer_reviews.text: Ad says 150db. Thats an overstatement unless 150db is equivalent to a standard car horn. This single 12" air horn is a dudd. No outstanding difference than what my stock horn produces in sound volume.
customer_reviews.author: Delpinon

customer_reviews.title: LOUD
customer_reviews.text: I mounted this horn on my motorcycle in place of the stock "horn like object." This thing is LOUD. Extremely LOUD. Horn mounted to one of the fork tubes and the compressor mounted in place of the stock horn.
customer_reviews.author: MGC

customer_reviews.title: Recieved the kit with a broken relay and no wires or instructions for the possible wires.
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the box I found a broken relay, no wires and no instructions as to what a person is supposed to attach the assembly to. I was under the impression thru the reading that all I had to do was remove the old and replace with the new but the wires do not support and you apparently have to get a extra wires set. That should come with the kit.
customer_reviews.author: rushnack

customer_reviews.title: Looks OK...doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Compressor ran, but did not put out enough air to even make a 1db sound. Quickly returned.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Loud!!
customer_reviews.text: Been working great for about six months. The horn itself is quite large, I ended up having to mount it behind the bumper facing the passenger side of the car. Probably would be better pointed downward or forward. Never fails to startle, much better than puny Toyota factory horns. Planning on install in my other car as well.
customer_reviews.author: Anton

customer_reviews.title: Very Loud Horn!
customer_reviews.text: Very loud horn. Installed on my Harley hanging from highway bar behind forks. Only place I could fit. I guess they couldn't hear me running V&H Big Shots with half baffle, but they definitely hear me now & very quickly get out of my space they are trying to take. I seen them drop they're phones cause it scares the Crap out of them! People, get off your 📱 (phone) & pay attention to the Road!! Very Loud Horn! I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Leicht

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement horn
customer_reviews.text: Have not installed yet, but my husband hooked it up to a battery just so he could hear it. It is plenty loud. We bought it to replace the horn on our motorhome, which is so quiet it is pointless to even use ( and a little embarrassing) I think we will be very happy with the horn, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: jo

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Worked a couple of times then stopped working very poorly made
customer_reviews.author: Aaaahh yahhhh

customer_reviews.title: Great value!!!
customer_reviews.text: at first I was a little wishy-washy about buying this because of the price, but I said you can’t go wrong for 30$ so I bought it. boy am I glad I did! It’s soooo loud compared to stock horns. I put it in a 2000 Jeep Cherokee. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Jake heron

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so cheap, it broke before I even got a chance to test it. Save your money and just buy and actual train horn with a compressor. This thing is a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: This is easily worth the money. Not train loud but way loud. I hook it to my Jeep that had a duel tone from the factory. Added this to those and now have a tri-tone horn. Very cool.
customer_reviews.author: Glen

customer_reviews.title: Very very loud air horn
customer_reviews.text: Only giving this a 4 star because the relay was broken. Had to get another from advance auto but other then that it’s a great air horn. I drive 18 wheelers for a living and it’s louder then my big rig.
customer_reviews.author: LacylayOfficial

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and loud.
customer_reviews.text: Putting this on my Polaris slingshot. Haven't got it fully mounted but after testing it out, I am very pleased with sound level. Mounting is a little tricky on the slingshot since space is limited for a bell horn. But I'm gonna make it work and have good time. Will most likely order another and mount on the other side.
customer_reviews.author: JeffY

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Well the horn sounded good for about three months until I got caught in the rain from Virginia back to Florida went to use the horn today and it sound like it had tennis balls stuffed in it. So I took it all apart parently water got in. I sprayed it with some WD-40 to get the motor I guess to spin again tested it before I put it back in the truck work good put it back in the truck now. It sounds like it's got 1 tennis balls in it. Not very waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Sloan

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one to add to my existing horn, was thinking it would make it twice as loud. It did make it louder but ended up being a different sound, which I actually like.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware! Pump is worthless junk!
customer_reviews.text: I got this horn for my husband for Christmas and he spent a good 1 1/2 hours getting it installed only to discover that the pump was junk! He ended up spending his own money to buy a replacement pump as he didn't want to go through having to take the junk one out and reinstall perhaps yet another junk one! I thought I was buying a new item, obviously not.
customer_reviews.author: Zandra Sanborn

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: Nice strong sound, completely will take you off guard. I will be purchasing one more for that over the top completely ridiculous unnecessary sound! Wish it came with a wire harness but oh well you can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: Maverick Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product for an amazing price
customer_reviews.text: Received the horn on time in great working condition. It’s an amazing horn for the price you pay, the horn itself is of metal construction along with the air pump. Mounting was easy enough even though I had to fabricate mounts for the area I placed it in. Works like a charm and is as loud as advertised. Only complaint is that the hose that goes from pump to horn seems like it’ll melt in the engine bay, but I have not had any problems with that so far.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Great air horn!
customer_reviews.text: This horn is very loud, I love it! Everyone I've shown it to has been impressed as well. Simple, quick install. Well worth the purchase and price was extremely low!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff R.

customer_reviews.title: Loud attention getters
customer_reviews.text: I love this horn, or I should say these horns since I purchased two. They are very long so you'll need some room to install them, but they are very loud.
customer_reviews.author: BTCTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Zento Deals 12 v Trump Air Horn
customer_reviews.text: The horn and the air pump appear to be well-constructed. It would be better if the pump had mounting bracket instead of the one bolt to hold it in place. The air hose was a little too short, so I had to purchase additional hose. The installation instructions were written by someone not well-versed in English, but the installation was pretty easy to figure out. The horn is loud and I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Beauregard

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed to say the least
customer_reviews.text: The horn arrived, no paperwork/instructions came with it. Simple 2 Connector hook up and the compressor does not work. Very disappointed to say the least., after messing with the case which was loose got it working. For the price it is plenary loud.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L.

customer_reviews.title: Easy install !
customer_reviews.text: This horn is great I gave it to my grandson for a Christmas gift he installed it that day and loved it. It's not as loud as I thought but it's loud enough lol. I might get one for my truck...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs more air
customer_reviews.text: Horn appears to be good quality, however the compressor that is included does not provide enough air to get the full potential out of the horn. A weak sound at best. Since it is already installed, I'll keep it, but another air source will be needed to make the horn work as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Tipton

customer_reviews.title: Shorted out BUYER BEWARE!
customer_reviews.text: Worst product I’ve ever purchased on amazon. Shorted out immediately on first honk. If it weren’t for the fuses and relays I purchased my car would have thousands in damage to electrical system. It shorted out and crossed connections internally somehow when tested on a stand alone battery connected positive to positive and negative to negative and the damn thing melted the terminals on the battery. BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.author: JESSE COX

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Could be louder. Wiring instruction s would be nice. Chrome was flaking off in the box. Not a big deal since I mounted it concealed. You get what you pay for. It's decent overall.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Brown

customer_reviews.title: I've bought two now
customer_reviews.text: So I was gifted this horn two years ago and it's a secondary horn (with a hidden button) it's awesome. I scare old people, everyone is looking for a truck. I just aquired a ram 1500 I bought another horn to install in that as secondary. Fun times.
customer_reviews.author: Burrz

customer_reviews.title: Air Horn not as loud as expected
customer_reviews.text: Installation instructions not clear or fully available. Had to use utube for the installation. It is not nearly as loud as I expected. Will be replacing it with something better.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Diguardo

customer_reviews.title: Small hose, but super loud
customer_reviews.text: Pretty ease to intall. The hardest part was finding where the horn can go. And the hose is really small so I bought a air hose from Walmart and made it work. Now it's super loud and hidden.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: deep tone
customer_reviews.text: plenty loud. just wired into original horn line, now my factory horn and this horn go off when I honk. I love it.had a hard time find a deep tone hors. this is it.
customer_reviews.author: BDAN

customer_reviews.title: Sound like a train.
customer_reviews.text: Good value for a loud train type horn. Sure does get there attention.:) Would definitely recommend a relay for install. Connecting to existing wiring will blow fuse.
customer_reviews.author: Donna S.

customer_reviews.title: Plenty loud
customer_reviews.text: Made my toyota truck sound like a truck when I blow the horn. The old horn beeped and was an embarrassment. This horn sounds like authority and can't be missed. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: sandman

customer_reviews.title: Great horn, make sure you have room to mount it, very loud!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this on a prime deal. Easy to install horn, compressor has no mounting bracket just a slot so will need access to back side to tighten a bolt to secure it. Worked flawlessly loud as heck!! Perfect horn to get attention
customer_reviews.author: tool toy time

customer_reviews.title: Pump is trash.
customer_reviews.text: Horn is great. Looks brand new. Not a scratch. The pump on the other hand looks badly damaged and does not hold pressure strait out of the box. Tried it through a harness and wouldn't work. Tried strait to the battery and didnt work. I filled my air compressor up maybe 20 psi and just blew air through it. Sounded great. Just going to get a tank to install and keep these pumps in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin Westerman

customer_reviews.title: Decent sound
customer_reviews.text: Loud sounds like a smaller truck air horn., the positive pin pushed in, had to pull it out, cut the waterproof female pin cover and hold tab as pushing on. Then used luiquid tape. Wired to factory horn wire.
customer_reviews.author: Beau G

customer_reviews.title: Great horn! Looks nice, easy to wire, LOUD!
customer_reviews.text: Loud horn for my 1975 aquasport 170 restoration! I love it, it looks really nice too.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Good loud horn
customer_reviews.text: Good loud horn. Just took off a star because everything I needed didn't come with it but it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Tawnya Lieder

customer_reviews.title: Horn I would not advise anyone to buy
customer_reviews.text: Did not come with any instructions and no hardware except for mounting bolts would not recommend for anybody to buy
customer_reviews.author: william lauer

customer_reviews.title: Lacking Durability
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the price, but I’ve only had it just over a month and having intermittent horn issues. Sometimes it works & sometimes it doesn’t.... Although when it doesn’t work, the pump is. I’ve checked for obstructions or a damaged air line. Occasionally it makes a pitiful whimper... I’m not impressed!
customer_reviews.author: CHRIS

customer_reviews.title: LOUD
customer_reviews.text: So loud! Finally got around to wiring it up. Scared the crap out of me when I first tried it. A lot louder than I thought, which is a good thing! Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Deen Tuggle

customer_reviews.title: Horn only lasted a couple months
customer_reviews.text: The horn sure didn't last long after I installed it. And I installed it under the hood pointed downward so I know water and crud didn't get in it
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Rethink before you buy...
customer_reviews.text: I literally had to order this thing three times to get all the parts I needed.. even then I still didn't have the parts. I emailed customer service with no response at all multiple times.
customer_reviews.author: sean    gentry

customer_reviews.title: Wish it was louder but everything works
customer_reviews.text: I wish it could be a little louder. Sound more like a cargo truck type horn. (Add existing horn for a cleaner sound)
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo M.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good the only reason I did not give it 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good the only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because of the lack of instructions .. which was annoying. I have a 12ft pontoon boat I lwanted to mount a large horn to give the little girl a big voice and this fits the bill!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Zento Deals 12V Single Trumpet Air Horn Single Trumpet Air Horn + Compressor Powerful Loud 150db for Truck Boat SUV Train
feature_bullets: • POWERFUL - The Zento Deals single horn blares out a loud and powerful warning. It can produce sound as loud as 150DB. The great powerful sound catches everyone's attention.

• SUPERIOR QUALITY - The Zento Deals single horn is constructed out of premium quality material to ensure maximum strength and durability for long lasting usage. The Zento Deals single horn is sturdy and made of material tough enough to withstand the any weather and form of elements of blizzard.

• VERSATILITY - The Zento Deals single horn can be mounted on any application that has a 12V DC power available. With a polished red compressor and shiny chrome horn they cast an eye-catching appearance on any vehicle mounted.
• AFFORDABLE - The Zento Deals single horn is designed for customers looking for a loud and affordable air horn. The build quality is great and totally worth it for a very affordable price.

• EASY INSTALLATION - The Zento Deals single horn is easy to install. It is flexible and portable so it has the reflexes to take from one car to another easily. The horn kit includes basic mounting hardware and hose.

specifications.Vehicle Service Type: Passenger Car, Van, Motorcycle, SUV, Truck, Watercraft
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars1,258 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
